Method Detail

stripLeadingDigits

public static String stripLeadingDigits(String str)
Strip all leading digits from a string. For example, "1234abc" becomes "abc". If the string is comprised entirely of digits, the empty string is returned.

Parameters:
str - string to strip
Returns:
string with leading digits stripped

isValidDNSSuffix

public static boolean isValidDNSSuffix(String suffix)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException
Check if the given DNS suffix is valid by checking that each label is at least 1 and at most 63 characters in length. Also check that each label has only characters, numbers, or '-', and that the entire suffix is at most 255 - 63 - 1 characters, since it will be appended to a single label later on to create a hostname. Also need to check that no label ends in a dash.

Parameters:
suffix - the suffix to check
Returns:
true is it is valid and false if it is not
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException
